respStmt.resp: Conversion to TEI based on earlier work for the ENRICH project (enrich@oucs.ox.ac.uk; http://tei.oucs.ox.ac.uk/ENRICH/)

summary.p: Collection of fragments from the Bliss & Phillipps collections including St. Paul, Epistle to the Romans with Commentary of Gilbert de la Porrée (fol. 26), Flemish (?), 12th century, end.
The fragments are arranged as follows:

decoDesc.decoNote: Fine initial on fol. 26. (P&A i. 279, pl. XIX)

recordHist.source: Typescript description by Bodleian library staff

msItem.title: Vita S. Milburge virginis
msItem.note: (as in Gotha MS. I 81 fol.166v–175, see Analecta Bollandiana 58, 1940, 99–100, and Lincoln Cath. MS. 149 fol. 83v)

msItem.rubric: Prologus Domni atonis hostiensis episcopi cardinalis in miraculis inventionis sancte milburge virginis
msItem.note: Edited from Lincoln Cath. MS. 149, fol. 87r-89v by P. A. Hayward in English Historical Review 114 (1999) 543-73 (563-73)

supportDesc.extent:
Lower part of leaf, the rest of which is MS. Rawl. Q. b. 4 fol.7v-r; see also Christ Church Muniments MS. X (1). c. 1 (noted Bodl. Lib. Rec. 5 (1954-6), 109.
370 285
280 185

history.provenance: Part of the cover of a Merton College business book ‘Anno 1o Regin. Mariae ad an. 27m. Regin Elizab. A.D. 1585’

msItem.author: Rufinus
msItem.title: Historia monachorum

msItem.author: Gregory I
msItem.title: Moralia
msItem.note: IX.84–96 marked 20 i – 23 m, with lemmata in green and red, pr. PL. 75.904 D.3 – 912 B.5

msItem.author: Aristotle
msItem.title: Topica
msItem.note: VIII.155 a.39 – 156 b.11 transl. Boethius pr.PL.64.1000 A.7 – 1002 A.5, one leaf from the same manuscript as MS. Magd. Coll. 271 nos.16–17. Ker Pastedowns no.165

history.provenance: a pastedown from Magd. Coll. C.7.13

msItem.title: Treatise on Consequentiae (part) and some Quaestiones on universals, contingents etc.

msItem.author: Bartholomaeus Anglicus
msItem.title: De proprietatibus rerum
msItem.note: XV.118–126 pr. Nuremburg 1519

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss ‘Philip Bliss from A. Moir’

msItem.author: Aegidius Romanus
msItem.title: Quodlibet
msItem.note: II quest.10–12, pr. Venice 1504 fol.18 col.2 1.26 - fol.19 col.2 1 line from end

msItem.author: Jerome
msItem.title: Ep. 53
msItem.note: 1.3–4, 4.1–5.1, pr. ed. I Hilberg, Vienna 1910 (CSEL. LIV 444.5–13, 449.14–451.1) with commentary probably by Guilelmus Brito

msItem.author: Gescelinus de Cassanis
msItem.title: Apparatus super Clementinas
msItem.note: III 7.2–8.1 as in MS. New Coll. 180 fol.93r col.1–94r col.1

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss ‘from a Catullus of Dr. Bentleys - P. Bliss from A. Moir 1805’ (cf.item C.m)

msItem.title: Theological texts

msItem.note: End of a work on Spes
Beginning of a text
msItem.incipit: Sine intermissione orare, duobus modis mihi videtur fieri posse

msItem.author: Innocent IV
msItem.title: In 5 libros Decretalium

msItem.author: Henricus de Segusio (Hostiensis)
msItem.title: Apparatus in libres Decretalium
msItem.note: prologue, pr. Venice 1581, beg. (fol.3 col. 1) fol.4v col.1 § 39

msItem.title: Summary of Thomas Aquinas, Summa Theologiae
msItem.note: part: IIa IIae 64.1–66.6, 77.2–78.1, pr. Turin, 1948
Kept as MS. Lat. misc. a. 2, fol.25

msItem.author: Johannes Duns Scotus
msItem.title: Quaestiones in libros Sententiarum
msItem.note: III dist. 1 quest. 1, pr. Lyons 1639 vol.7 scholia pp.10–16

msItem.title: Apocalypse
msItem.note: 22.13-end with contemporary notes. See N. R. Ker, Pastedowns in Oxford bindings, no. 403 n. 3

msItem.title: Liber Sapientie
msItem.note: I.1–14, with prologue (Isidorus, Etymologiae VI.ii.30 = Berger no.142)

msItem.title: Commentary on Pauline Epistles

history.provenance: Used as the cover of Christopher Carlile, A discourse wherein is plainly proved that Peter was never at Rome, 1572

msItem.title: Romans, glossed
msItem.note: (1.1–8, with commentary of Gilbert de la Porrée)

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorative initial in gold, blue, red, mauve, white edged with green

history.provenance: 14th cent. note ‘de Camberone’ (the Cistercian abbey of Cambron, Belgium)

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Gloss on the Psalms

msItem.author: Peter Lombard
msItem.title: Commentary on Romans
Epistle to Hebrews
msItem.note: 13.17-end; with commentary of Peter Lombard, pr. pr. PL. 192.517 A.12 – 520 A.5

msItem.title: Homiliary
msItem.note: parts of sermons 86 (= Augustine, Tractatus in Johannis evangelium 51.3–8, pr. PL. 35.1765.3 – 1766.42) and 87 (= Jerome, Commentarium in Matthaeum 21.1, pr PL. 26. 146 B.3 – C.1)

msItem.title: De civitate dei
msItem.note: II 24–5, III 20–21, pr. ed. E. Hoffmann, Vienna 1900 (CSEL 40), parts of pp. 98 line 3 – 101 line 13, 145 line 9 – 148 line 17

msItem.title: Expositio psalmi CXVIII
msItem.note: 13.2.2–3, 3.2, pr. ed. M. Petschenig, Vienna 1913 (CSEL LXII)

msItem.title: Vita metrica S. Mariae Aegyptiacae
Poem
msItem.note: part of a poem in elegiac couplets about Bernardus

msItem.title: Sententiae

msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.note: IV.17.1–3, pr. Quaracchi 1916, II. 847–52; with commentary added in 15th. cent. Ker, op. cit., 1763 n. 1

msItem.title: Sententiae
msItem.note: IV. 50.3–7, pr. Quaracchi 1916, II. 1035–8.

msItem.title: Commentary on Petrus Lombardus, Sententiae

msItem.title: Summa theologiae
msItem.note: la 2ae q.14 a.1– 15.a.3, numbered 82–88, pr. Turin 1948, II. 71–76

msItem.title: Glossary
msItem.note: in Latin with some Anglo-Saxon glosses, from the same manuscript as B.M. Harl. 3376

msItem.title: [Osborn of Gloucester, Derivationes] , , 2 cols., perhaps , ; z
msItem.note: copia-contemplari (with short version of repetitiones) pr. Classicorum auctorum e Vaticanis codicibus editorum, ed. A. Mai, Rome, 1836, VIII.128–36, 138–48, with marginal additions from Hugutio of Pisa, Liber derivationum, as in MS. Laud misc.626 fol.17v–39v]

msItem.author: Johannes Balbus de Janua
msItem.title: Catholicon
msItem.note: dicto-dilectio, pr. Lyon, 1514, fols. 6–7v

msItem.author: Virgil
msItem.title: Aeneid

msItem.author: Geoffrey de Vinsauf
msItem.title: Poetria Nova
msItem.note: lines 1311ff. ed. Faral

history.provenance: Labelled by Bliss 'Philip Bliss 1805 from his friend Robt. Tindale. (from an old and most beautiful Copy of the Laws of the Emperor Iustinian printed at Paris by Claude Chevallon 1526'.

msItem.title: Document
msItem.note: Fragment of a letter under the Great Seal (missing) to a sheriff to right a wrong judgement 28 July 17 Eliz.I.

msItem.title:
Liturgical fragments (of which m, y, z and ff are from books bound in Oxford):
a

Gospel book, temporale, parts of gospels for Thursday & Friday in 2nd week of Lent (Joh.5 30–47, Mat.21.33–46), part of an inner bifolium, originally c.285–90 x 230 (200x145) mm., German, beginning of the 11th cent.; b (fol.60a) Gospel book or missal, part of passion according to St.Luke, one leaf, Belgian (?) 11th cent.(?); c (fol.60b) Gospel book or missal, part of passion according to St. Luke 22.58, 66, with the parts marked in red, part of a leaf, English, 2nd half of 13th cent.; d

Noted missal, temporale, parts of 14th & 15th weeks after Pentecost, with adiastematic rhythmical neums of St.Gall type, one leaf, S.German, 1st half of 12th cent., bearing a 19th cent.printed label 116 (cf. items p, cc); e
Missal (?), fragment of leaf, 2 cols., English (?) 13th cent., with later scribbles including ‘Wyllyam Horton ys boke’ and ‘1528’; f
Noted missal, from the common of a bishop & confessor, with square notation on staves of 4 red lines, one leaf, 2 cols., English 14th cent.; g
Kept as MS. lat. liturg. a. 8, fol. 63
Rubricated missal, part of mass of the dedication, part of a leaf, 2 cols., English 15th cent., later used as cover of a book; i

Missal, temporale, end of gospel for Friday before 4th or 5th Sunday after Pentecost (Luc.8.56), introit Respice in me, collect Protector in te, and part of gospel for same Sunday, part of a leaf, German (?) 15th cent.; j
Missal, sanctorale, part of mass of St.George (23 April) with part of a sequence & parts of mass for Pentecost and St. Barnabas, part of a bifolium, 2 cols., Low Countries (?) 1st half 15th cent.; k
Missal without lessons, temporale, parts of masses for Sunday of octave & for octave day of Epiphany, part of a leaf, 2 cols., German 15th cent., (sewn to it with green silk thread was
a scrap of paper with accounts in German (15th. cent.); l

Noted ferial psalter with opening words of some antiphons in upper margins, point neum notation perhaps derived from Metz neums on staves of 4 or 5 red lines, part of a leaf, German, perhaps 11th cent.; m

Portable psalter, parts of Ps.13.29–104.29, part of a leaf, 2 cols., English 14th cent., noted by Bliss ‘From a Catullus formerly in the Possession of Dr. Bentley = Philip Bliss 1805 from his Friend A.L.Moir.’ (cf.item A.i); n
Order of ferial psalter, Sunday hymns from Epiphany to 1st Sunday in Lent with antiphons etc. & opening words of psalms for 1st nocturn on Sundays, one leaf (recto blank), N.Italian ? 15th cent.?; O
Portable psalter, parts of Ps.141.3 – 142.4, 143.14 – 144.11, part of a bifolium, German c.1200 ?; p

Antiphonal, temporale,
some respensories etc. for matins of 3rd Sunday in Advent, antiphons etc. for Wednesday to Saturday in the same week, and the antiphon O sapientia, with Gothic notation on staves of 4 black lines, 2 leave German monastic work of early 13th cent., bearing a 19th cent.printed label 100 (cf.items d, cc); q

Antiphonal, temporale, last responsories of matins, lauds, little Hours & 3 antiphons of vespers for Christmas, with Gothic notation on staves of 4 black lines, 2 cols., one leaf, German (?) 1st half of 14th cent.; r
Hymnal, hymns for week after Epiphany, for Easter, Corpus Christi and S.John Baptist, part of 2 bifolia, 2 cols., Low Countries, early (?) 15th cent.; s

Noted choir breviary, temporale, part of 1st Sunday after octave of Epiphany, with adiastematic notation tending towards point-neums, part of a leaf, 2 cols., German, 1st half of 12th cent., with 18th cent. shelf mark L.i.N:40; t

Noted choir breviary, sanctorale, part of matins and lauds for Purification of the Virgin (2 Feb.), with adiastematic notation in which the virga is a point-neum, part of a leaf, German secular work, c.1100; u

Noted choir breviary, temporale, part of Office of Holy Trinity, & some lessons for 2nd & 3rd weeks after Pentecost, with fine square notation on staves of 4 red lines, part of a bifolium, 2 cols., English 12th cent.; v

Noted choir breviary, temporale, most of Passion Sunday, parts of Palm Sunday & subsequent Monday, adiastematic point neum notation with some Notker letters, parts of 2 bifolia, Luxemburg or W.German secular work of 12th cent., from the binding of a book belonging in the 18th cent. to ‘carmeli crucenacensis’ (of Kreuznach nr Coblenz) marked CL:5. Lin:2. Num 35 1740 (with it was
a narrow strip with Italian diastematic neums on a stave with red F line); w

Noted choir breviary, temporale, lessons from Genesis & responsories for Tuesday- Friday in the week of Septuagesima with half-diastematic neums related to the notation of Chartres, part of a leaf, 2 cols., French 12th cent.; x

Noted choir breviary, lessons of I Mach. with the responsorial historia Adaperiat, & parts of 14th & 15th Sundays after Pentecost, adiastematic point-neum notation, part of a bifolium & 2 small scraps, W.German monastic work of late 12th cent.; y

Rubricated & noted choir breviary, sanctorale, part of feast of 11,000 virgins (21 Oct.), Offices of SS.Simon & Jude (28 Oct.) & St.Quintinus (31 Oct.), 1st vespers, compline & 2 nocturns of All Saints (1 Nov.), with collects added for St.Romanus & SS.Crispinus & Crispinianus (23 & 25 Oct.), square notation on staves of 4 red lines, 2 leaves, 2 cols., Sarum, 13th cent. (probably from an Oxford binding); z

Noted choir breviary, part of Lenten litany & its variations for each day of the week, with music on 4 red lines not filled in, upper part of a leaf, 2 cols., Sarum 15th cent., (probably from an Oxford binding); aa

Choir breviary, temporale, lessons for matins of 4th & 5th days in octave of Epiphany, one leaf, 2 cols., Spanish or S.French secular work of 14th cent., used later as a cover marked in 19th cent. 6013; bb
Choir breviary, sanctorale, parts of Offices of St.Peter and Visitation of the Virgin with marginal notes, a bifolium, palimpsest, Austrian or N.E.Italian monastic work, c.1500; cc

Portable breviary,
sanctorale, parts of proper Offices of St.Agatha (5 Feb.), St. Matthias patronus (24 Feb.), St.Gregory (12 Mar.), without title, indications for antiphons responseries or versicles, opening words of psalms, or lessons, 2 consecutive inner bifolia, 2 cols., Flemish late 12th cent., with 19th cent. printed label 69 (cf.items d, p); dd
Portable breviary, Common of the Saints, lessons 2–4 & responsories at matins for the evangelists, one leaf, Low Countries monastic (?) work of 1st half of 15th cent.; ee
Portable breviary (?), temporale, last lessons & responsories (Sicut ovis, Agnus dei Christus) of matins, lauds etc. of Holy Saturday, one leaf, 2 cols., French c.1300; ff
Martyrology, 1–8 and 25–30 March, a bifolium, 2 cols., English late 14th cent. (probably from an Oxford binding); gg
Martyrology, eulogies of 10–12 Feb., one leaf, initials illuminated in blue, red & gold, French late 15th cent.

Legal fragments (and see also A, items i, k, l):
a
[Digest VIII.6.6 – IX.1.5 with some Accursian glosses], one leaf, 2 cols., Italian 13th cent.; b
[Digest XIX. 2.60–61, 4.1, 5.4–5 with Accursian glosses,] part of a leaf, 2 cols., 13th cent.; c
/ kept as MS.Lat.Misc.a.2, fols. 26–7; d
[Codex IV.38.13 – 44.2 with a few Accursian glosses & other notes], one leaf, 2 cols., Italian 14th cent.; e
[Decretum pt.II VIII.1.17 – 3.1, X.1.12 – 3.2] with some glosses, a bifolium, 2 cols., Italian, 12–13th cent.; f
[Decretales I 6.28, 30] with glossa ordinania, part of leaf, late 13th cent.; g
[Decretales IV 18.1 – 19.1] with glossa ordinaria, lower half of leaf, 2 cols., 13th–14th cent.; h
[Joannes Andreae, Nouella commentaria in Decretales II 21.7 (§ 13)– 10( §11)] pr. Venice 1581 fol.160v–161v, part of leaf, Italian 14th cent.; i
Clementines
msItem.note: II.11.2–12.2 with glossa ordinaria on II. 12.3

msItem.author: Raymundus de Pennaforte
msItem.title: Summa de casibus de poenitentia
De appellationibus
msItem.note: part of a work; quoting Decret.II 2.6 and Decretal.I 29, II 28 but no commentators

msItem.title: Year Book of 9 [Ed.III]
msItem.note: Parts of Hilary & Trinity terms pr. London 1596 (Beale, Bibliography no. R.3) fol.333–334v, 343v–345

msItem.title: Unidentified work
